alert.note: Alert for Frazier Mountain Communities; Fresno-Tulare Lower Sierra; Grant Grove Area; Grapevine; Kaiser to Rodgers Ridge; Kern River Valley; Kings Canyon NP; Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; Piute Walker Basin; San Joaquin River Canyon; Sequoia NP; South End of the Lower Sierra; South End of the Upper Sierra; Tehachapi; Upper San Joaquin River; Yosemite NP outside of the valley; Yosemite Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 7:34PM PST until December 30 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM WEDNESDAY TO 10 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. For areas north of Kern County, total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches between 3,000 and 6,000 feet and 8 to 16 inches with isolated amounts up to 2 feet above 6,000 feet. For Kern County, 2 to 6 inches between 4,000 and 6,000 feet with 6 to 12 inches above 6,000 feet. A trace to 2 inches along the Kern mountain passes. * WHERE...Sierra Nevada mountains and foothills above 3,000 feet as well as the Kern County mountains above 4,000 feet. * WHEN...From 4 AM Wednesday to 10 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
